He will forgive my Sonia because she has loved a lot. I know this in my heart after being with her. He will judge everyone, both good and bad, wise and humble. When He is done, He will call us all. He will say, “You too come here, you drunks, you weak ones, you people full of shame!” We will all come forward without feeling ashamed and stand before Him. He will tell us, “You are like pigs, made in the image of the Beast, but come anyway!” The wise people will ask, “Lord, why do you accept these men?” He will reply, “I accept them because none of them think they deserve it.” He will open His arms to us, and we will fall down before Him, crying, and we will understand everything! Then we will all understand, even Katerina Ivanovna. She will understand too. Lord, let Your kingdom come! 

He then sank down on the bench, tired and helpless, not looking at anyone and lost in deep thought. His words made an impact, and there was a brief silence, but soon laughter and swearing started again. 

“That’s his idea!”  
“He talked himself silly!”  
“What a fine clerk he is!”  
And so on.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Marmeladov expresses a profound belief in divine forgiveness for all, including the marginalized and sinful, before succumbing to exhaustion and indifference from those around him.
